actor_awards.notes: Received an Honorary Academy Award in 1987 for his unique artistry and distinguished service to the profession of acting. Known as the quintessential 'other man' in screwball comedies and for his acclaimed portrayal of Franklin D. Roosevelt.

filmography.title: The Awful Truth
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, genial, but somewhat dull Oklahoma oilman who becomes engaged to the protagonist's ex-wife.
filmography.plot: A married couple divorces after a series of misunderstandings, but they sabotage each other's attempts to find new romance.

filmography.title: His Girl Friday
filmography.role_description: The mild-mannered, dependable insurance salesman fiancé of reporter Hildy Johnson, who is outmatched by her ex-husband.
filmography.plot: A newspaper editor uses every trick in the book to keep his ace reporter ex-wife from remarrying.

filmography.title: Rosemary's Baby
filmography.role_description: A renowned and seemingly benevolent obstetrician who is actually part of a sinister coven.
filmography.plot: A young couple moves into an apartment in an area with a bad reputation, and the wife becomes pregnant with a child she suspects is not of this world.

filmography.title: Trading Places
filmography.role_description: One of two wealthy, callous commodities broker brothers who make a cruel bet involving the lives of two men.
filmography.plot: A snobbish investor and a wily street con artist find their positions reversed as part of a bet by two callous millionaires.

filmography.title: Sunrise at Campobello
filmography.role_description: Bellamy reprises his Tony-winning stage role as FDR, depicting the future President's struggle with polio.
filmography.plot: The story of Franklin D. Roosevelt's battle with polio and his return to politics with the help of his wife Eleanor and devoted advisor Louis Howe.

filmography.title: The Professionals
filmography.role_description: A wealthy Texas rancher who hires a team of mercenaries to rescue his kidnapped wife.
filmography.plot: An arrogant Texas millionaire hires four professional fortune hunters to rescue his wife from a Mexican bandit.

filmography.title: Pretty Woman
filmography.role_description: The owner of a struggling shipyard company who appeals to the corporate raider protagonist's conscience. (His final film role)
filmography.plot: A man in a legal but hurtful business needs an escort for some social events and hires a beautiful prostitute he meets.

filmography.title: The Wolf Man
filmography.role_description: The Chief Constable of the village who investigates the mysterious animal attacks.
filmography.plot: A practical man returns to his homeland, is attacked by a creature of folklore, and infected with a horrific disease his disciplined mind tells him cannot possibly exist.

filmography.title: Brother Orchid
filmography.role_description: A straight-laced rancher who becomes a rival for the affections of the protagonist's girlfriend.
filmography.plot: A gangster posing as a monk to escape his rivals discovers the peaceful life of the monastery.

filmography.title: Hands Across the Table
filmography.role_description: A wealthy ex-aviator confined to a wheelchair who falls in love with a manicurist.
filmography.plot: A manicurist looking for a rich husband and a former millionaire playboy fall in love, complicating their plans.

filmography.title: Picture Snatcher
filmography.role_description: The editor who gives James Cagney's character a chance as a photographer.
filmography.plot: An ex-con becomes a tabloid photographer and gets into trouble when he snaps a photo of an execution.

filmography.title: The Court-Martial of Billy Mitchell
filmography.role_description: The civilian defense counsel who represents Billy Mitchell during his court-martial.
filmography.plot: General Billy Mitchell is court-martialed for accusing the military brass of incompetence regarding air power.

filmography.title: Coming to America
filmography.role_description: A cameo reprising his role from 'Trading Places', now destitute and receiving a handout.
filmography.plot: An extremely pampered African prince travels to Queens, New York, and goes undercover to find a wife who he can respect for her intelligence and will.

filmography.title: Forbidden
filmography.role_description: A newspaper editor who pursues a woman in love with a married politician.
filmography.plot: A woman falls in love with a man she meets on a cruise, only to discover he is married, but she devotes her life to him anyway.

filmography.title: Boy Meets Girl
filmography.role_description: A serious-minded studio producer dealing with two eccentric screenwriters.
filmography.plot: Two screenwriters hatch a plot to make a western star out of an infant.

filmography.title: Carefree
filmography.role_description: The fiancé of Ginger Rogers' character who sends her to a psychiatrist (Fred Astaire).
filmography.plot: A psychiatrist falls in love with his friend's fiancée while treating her for her hesitation to get married.

filmography.title: Dance, Girl, Dance
filmography.role_description: The director of a ballet company who becomes the object of affection for two dancers.
filmography.plot: A ballet dancer and a burlesque queen compete for the same man while struggling to achieve their dreams.

filmography.title: The Secret Six
filmography.role_description: Bellamy's film debut, playing a wealthy slaughterhouse owner involved with gangsters.
filmography.plot: Bootleggers are hired by a slaughterhouse owner to help him undercut his competition, leading to a gang war.

filmography.title: Ellery Queen, Master Detective
filmography.role_description: Bellamy stars as the famous amateur detective in the first of a series of films.
filmography.plot: Ellery Queen investigates the murder of a wealthy health fanatic.

filmography.title: Oh, God!
filmography.role_description: The lawyer who defends the man who claims to have spoken to God.
filmography.plot: God appears to an assistant grocery manager as a good-natured old man and asks him to spread a message.

filmography.title: Guest in the House
filmography.role_description: An illustrator whose happy family life is disrupted by a manipulative young woman.
filmography.plot: A mentally unstable young woman moves into her doctor's home and begins to manipulate his family.

filmography.title: Spitfire
filmography.role_description: A wealthy engineer who is engaged to another woman but falls for a mountain girl.
filmography.plot: A mountain girl who believes she has healing powers is driven from her home by superstitious neighbors.

filmography.title: Lady on a Train
filmography.role_description: The nephew of a murdered shipping magnate, who becomes a suspect.
filmography.plot: A woman witnesses a murder from a train window and gets involved in solving the crime when the police don't believe her.

filmography.title: Blind Alley
filmography.role_description: A psychiatrist who is held hostage by an escaped killer and uses psychology to disarm him.
filmography.plot: An escaped killer hides out in the home of a psychiatrist, who delves into the killer's mind.

filmography.title: The Good Mother
filmography.role_description: The patriarch of the family in this drama about a custody battle.
filmography.plot: A divorced mother risks losing custody of her daughter when she begins a relationship with a man who allows the child to touch him.

filmography.title: Flying Devils
filmography.role_description: An aerial stuntman who plans to murder his wife's lover during a performance.
filmography.plot: An aerialist plots to kill the man his wife has fallen in love with during a mid-air stunt.
